basics.name: Shishir Amin
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Pragmatist. DevOps, automation and CICD enthusiast. Lifelong learner and personable team player. Flexible and always willing to dig in and solve new problems.

highlights: Help customers learn to run and operate their Pivotal Cloud Foundry(PCF) environments
Troubleshoot networking,IaaS,platform,etc.. issues that arise during installation/operation of PCF
Deploy PCF both manually and through automated concourse pipelines
Create and alter concourse pipelines to eliminate operator toil for PCF
Deployed, configued and supported OpenStack clouds as well as mission critical organizational shared services including package repositories and CICD software
Set up Rally (OpenStack) to collect benchmarks and run tests against deployed clouds to help identify and fix performance issues and bugs
Created Salt formulas to keep server configurations consistent and more easily manage infrastructure
Wrote Salt modules where necessary to extend SaltStack functionality for cloud platforms
Used openstack-ansible to deploy and re-deploy OpenStack clouds
Used ansible to deploy and maintain cloud and customer tenant information as code
Managed CICD infrastructure (TeamCity) and evangalized best practices
Assisted other developers with CICD pipelines and shared services when the need arose
Worked on-call rotations to quickly handle both production and development issues
Created documenation for on-call remediations, which allowed others on-call to easily resolve issues more quickly, leading to less downtime of our services
Added features to improve customer experience and increased stability through bug fix for an internal Java shared hosting platform.
Worked on an internal shared hosting service written in Perl
Delivered enhancements, fixed bugs and refactored legacy code
Agile software development using JIRA as a project management tool and SVN as version control
Focused heavily on increasing unit testing coverage
Provided escalation support for issues running in production
Cross-team collaboration with other shared services, customers of the product and other development groups within the bank
Developed virtual hardware environments (as VMWare VMs) of EMC Midrange storage platforms which helped reduce hardware costs for development.
Performed development and system administration roles
Created automated tooling around virtual machine deployment and configuration (using VMWare Perl APIs)
Cross-collaborated across development teams as multiple components of the stack had to be sometimes be altered for the virtual environments
Wrote C/C++ code as well as Bash and Perl scripts
Assisted with the Midrange NAS development team with their responsibilities and helped to manage our lab hardware.
Helped test developer code by installing builds and running test suites
Helped to debug issues with broken systems, or reinstall them if necessary
Got my feet wet fixing some simple bugs in the software
Revamped our lab hardware tracking website
